title: Cursor setup
description: Step-by-step setup flow for learn/apply. Use with setup-chat.html or a bot.

steps.title: Welcome
steps.message:
Let's get Cursor on your machine and verify it works. We'll do this step by step — you do each part, then tap **Next** when you're ready.

If your company blocks installs or SSO, reach **#ask-it** on Slack first.

steps.title: Check prerequisites
steps.message:
Before downloading, confirm:

• **OS:** macOS, Windows, or Linux
• **Access:** Admin/sudo (or Windows User install)
• **Internet:** Required (Cursor uses cloud AI)
• **RAM:** 8 GB min, 16 GB recommended for large codebases
• **Account:** GitHub or work account for sign-in
steps.action: Confirm you have these, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Download Cursor
steps.message:
Download the installer for your OS:

**[cursor.com](https://cursor.com)** or **[cursor.com/downloads](https://cursor.com/downloads)**

Choose your OS and architecture (e.g. Mac ARM64 for Apple Silicon, Windows User if you don't have admin).

steps.title: Install on macOS
steps.message:
1. Open the `.dmg` and drag **Cursor** to **Applications**.
2. Open Cursor from Applications or Spotlight.
3. If macOS says "unidentified developer": **System Settings → Privacy & Security** → allow Cursor.
4. On first launch, grant any requested permissions (e.g. Accessibility).
steps.action: Finish the install and launch Cursor once, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Install on Windows
steps.message:
1. Run the installer (User = no admin, System = admin).
2. Complete the steps.
3. Launch Cursor from the Start menu or desktop shortcut.
4. If policy blocks install, reach **#ask-it** on Slack.
steps.action: Finish the install and launch Cursor once, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Install on Linux
steps.message:
**.deb:** `sudo dpkg -i cursor*.deb` (then `sudo apt --fix-broken install` if needed)
**.rpm:** `sudo rpm -i cursor*.rpm`
**.AppImage:** `chmod +x Cursor*.AppImage` then run it (FUSE may be required).

Launch Cursor from your app menu or shell (`cursor` if in PATH).
steps.action: Finish the install and launch Cursor once, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Sign in
steps.message:
In Cursor: sign in with your work email or SSO (per company policy).

If sign-in fails or loops, try **Sign out** then sign in again, or reach **#ask-it**.
steps.action: Sign in to Cursor, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Verify AI works
steps.message:
Quick smoke test:

1. Open any file in Cursor (e.g. a `.md`).
2. Open **Chat** (sidebar or `Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+L`).
3. Ask: *Summarize the first paragraph.*

You should get a short reply. If not, see **troubleshooting → AI features** or **#ask-it**.
steps.action: Do the smoke test and see a reply, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: Read the mental model
steps.message:
One last step: read **Mental model: how to think with Cursor** (verify, validate, guardrails).

This is in your repo at `docs/mental-model.md`, or open it from the setup guide. It explains when to trust Cursor and when to double-check.
steps.action: Read the mental model doc, then tap **Next**.

steps.title: You're set
steps.message:
Setup is complete. Next:

• **Troubleshooting** — [docs/troubleshooting.md](troubleshooting.md)
• **Mental model** — when to trust / double-check
• **Example workflows** — [examples/](../examples/)
• **Prompts** — [docs/prompts.md](prompts.md)

Need help? **#ask-it** on Slack.
